result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy Lee Love Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tommy Lee Love Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Tommy Lee Love Jr.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense filed notice of motion and motion to suppress custodial statements and requested motion hearing date. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in room 310 of the Safety Building with Judge Franke. Defendant to be produced. Court scheduled deadline for State to file motion response by 11-18-2022. Motion hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Custodial Statements.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Tommy Lee Love Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Tommy Lee Love Jr.  Attorney Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Court orders case adjourned for a status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tommy Lee Love Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Tommy Lee Love Jr.  Attorney Amy Spanczak appeared on behalf of Patricia Irene Daugherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they are in receipt of a global offer, but needs additional time to review with client. No objections from the State. Court grants request and adjourns matter for a Status Conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tommy Lee Love in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel requests an additional Status Conference date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Tommy Lee Love not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements heard.  Branch 25 allows for transfer to Branch 16 for global resolution.,   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tommy Lee Love in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Tommy Lee Love in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Ryan DeWitt - MPD. Court took judicial notice of defendant's pending matter 17CF3171.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Reserve Branch, Judge Franke.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Tommy Lee Love in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Tommy Lee Love in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tommy Lee Love appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
